item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for August 13, 2024
item.description:
The New York Time Games has put together one of the more challenging Strands puzzles that fans have seen for today. Not only do you have to figure out the theme and the words to search up from just one clue, you also have to use every letter only once to complete it.

But today's puzzle is even more difficult than the rules of how to play Strands might suggest to you; it's got a theme and some words that players might not be able to find or think of. If you don't like the in-game hint system and are stuck on this puzzle, you should check out the hint-filled article below.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #163 August 13, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has six items to find in it: one Spangram and five themed words. The clue is Look It Up!

New York Times Games Strands Clues

General hints that will help you get a little closer to the theme today are in each of the covered-up sections below. If you want a hint that won't spoil any of the words in this innovative puzzle game, check them out.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Each of the expandable section below contains just one word from today's New York Times Games Strands puzzle along with its place in the letter grid. If you want to see one or both of them, click the Read More buttons below.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The full answer to the Strand puzzle for August 13, 2024 is in the expandable section below. Open it to see all the themed words and a screenshot of where all those words go in the grid of this challenging puzzle game.

Today's Strands Explained

In the section below, you can find the explanation for today's Strands puzzle number 163. If you don't get it, this section will explain how the Spangram, the themed words, and the clue all work together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Monopoly GO Partner Event Schedule (August 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • When Is The Next Partner Event in Monopoly GO?
  • What Are Monopoly GO Partner Events?

Monopoly GO keeps introducing new events now and then to keep gamers involved and entertained. These events are divided into Tournaments, Season Events, and Main Events, ensuring that players have plenty to keep them busy while they play the game.

Unlike Season Events that last three months, Main Events only last for a few days, so players will need to be quick if they wish to make the most of them. A Partner Event is one such event that rewards players with sticker packs, dice, and various other exciting prizes. For those wondering when the next one will be, this guide is here to help.

Updated by Usama Ali on August 12, 2024 : Monopoly GO’s Partner Events are an exciting chance to team up with friends and build amazing attractions together. For building all four landmarks, you and your friends can win tons of exclusive rewards, including a Wild Sticker. These collaborative events happen once a month, so you should make the most of them to avoid missing out. Gather your friends because an exciting new Partner Event is coming soon to Monopoly GO.

When Is The Next Partner Event in Monopoly GO?

Partner Events are fun collaborative events that add a sort of “co-op” element to Monopoly GO . These events last for four to five days and involve building unique attractions on the board with your friends. Since collaboration is key, you'll need to work together with your partner to collect themed tokens and spin the event wheel.

Monopoly GO’s Partner Events typically occur once a month , but the schedule often switches up to accommodate other exciting in-game events. Considering the event’s past occurrences, the next Partner Event in Monopoly GO, called Rocket Partners, is set to launch on August 15, 2024.

While the exact details of the Rocket Partners event are yet to be released, you can expect to build rocket-themed attractions with your friends and win epic rewards along the way. The grand prize includes a Wild Sticker, 5,000 Dice, and an all-new Retro Rocket token.

The table below gives a quick overview of all the Monopoly GO Partner Events that have occurred so far.

Event Name

Start Date

End Date

Ice Cream Partners

July 10, 2024

July 15, 2024

Aqua Partners

June 22, 2024

June 27, 2024

Robo Partners

May 16, 2024

May 21, 2024

Parade Partners

April 26, 2024

May 01, 2024

Fountain Partners

April 06, 2024

April 11, 2024

Hot Rod Partners

March 08, 2024

March 13, 2024

Valentine’s Partners

February 09, 2024

February 14, 2024

Gardening Partners

January 08, 2024

January 13, 2024

Gift Partners

December 15, 2023

December 20, 2023

Completing milestones can also allow you to get 5-star stickers since each slot will reward you with one purple sticker pack. These stickers can help you with completing the Making Music Sticker Album and get plenty of Dice Rolls and Cash for free.

What Are Monopoly GO Partner Events?

Monopoly GO Partner events are special group events in which boards have four slots, and you have to team up with other players to build attractions on them. These events offer many exciting prizes, including dice and sticker packs, but their main attraction is the grand prize of up to 5,000 dice and a special sticker pack.

It’s worth noting that, to join Partner events in Monopoly Go , players will have to reach Board 5 , which can be achieved in a few hours.

Can You Change Your Partner In The Partner Event?

No, players have never been able to switch partners across all Partner Events in the past. Once you become a partner with another player, it can’t be reversed for the rest of the event, so players must approach making this decision carefully.

item.title: Marvel's Wolverine: 10 Villains That Should Be In The Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Marvel's Wolverine by Insomniac Games promises exciting action and nostalgic references in the same universe as Spider-Man games.
  • Fan-favorite villains like Viper, Daken, Gorgon, and Sentinels could provide challenging boss fights and expand the game's universe.
  • Expect to see characters like Wendigo, Lady Deathstrike, Omega Red, and the Weapon X program play pivotal roles in Wolverine's story.

The future of Marvel video games seems bright with titles such as Marvel's Wolverine on the way. The game is another third-person action game developed by Insomniac Games, the same team behind the now-beloved Marvel's Spider-Man games, and is confirmed to be set in the same universe.

Considering how well Marvel's Spider-Man games have brought iconic villains to life for New York's web-slingers, fans wonder which villains James "Logan" Howlett will fight in Marvel's Wolverine . From fellow mutants to cybernetic killers, the potential for villains in the new open-world game is vast.

10 The Hulk

Wolverine's History Started With A Famous Rivalry

  • First Appearance : The Incredible Hulk #1
  • Real Name : Bruce Banner
  • Last Video Game Appearance : Marvel's Avengers, Marvel Snap, Marvel Rivals

There is no better way to celebrate the history of Logan than to have Marvel's Wolverine homage when the character first appeared. In The Incredible Hulk #181 , Wolverine is introduced as an adversary hunting the Hulk for the crimes committed by another monster, thus leading to an iconic rivalry between the two heroes.

In the original teaser trailer for Marvel's Wolverine , an Easter Egg referenced that particular comic. Perhaps gamers will experience a flashback to that meeting between Hulk and Wolverine or a villainous version of Hulk such as the Maestro will make a surprise appearance.

9 Viper

Her Inclusion Could Expand The Insomniac Universe

  • First Appearance : Captain America #110
  • Real Name : Ophelia Sarkissian
  • Last Video Game Appearance : LEGO Marvel's Avengers, Marvel Future Fight, Marvel Snap

The mutant known as Viper has had encounters with multiple Marvel heroes over the years, including Captain America. With Marvel's Wolverine taking place in the same universe as Marvel's Spider-Man , which teases the Avengers in the canon, Viper could be a way to show Logan and Captain America serving together in World War 2.

Viper is known for being an associate of Hydra, even donning the moniker of Madame Hydra in the past. Her inclusion in Marvel's Wolverine could not only expand on the Insomniac universe's past but provide a different kind of boss fight for Wolverine seeing how she is a tactical leader with an affinity for toxins.

8 Daken

Like Father, Like Unfortunate Son

  • First Appearance : Wolverine: Origins #10
  • Real Name : Akihiro
  • Last Video Game Appearances : Marvel Puzzle Quest, Marvel Strike Force, Marvel Future Fight

If Marvel's Wolverine wanted to tackle Logan dealing with the consequences of his loner lifestyle, Daken would be the ideal choice. Daken is Logan's long-lost son with the same signature mutant abilities, only he was raised by other people except for Logan himself, which has caused him to have hatred for his father among other reasons.

Even though it's a common trope to have the hero fight someone who is their darker equal, Daken would make a better example of it. Daken would not only allow Marvel's Wolverine to showcase Logan dealing with his mistakes but also how fortunate the world is that he turned out to be a good person.

7 Gorgon

Terrifying Villain For Mutants And Humans Alike

  • First Appearance : Wolverine Vol. 3 #20
  • Real Name : Tomi Shishido
  • Last Video Game Appearances : Marvel Heroes: Omega, Marvel Puzzle Quest

Since Marvel's Wolverine seems to be embracing a darker and bloodier adventure, Gorgon could be portrayed best with an M-rating. With the ability to turn people to stone by looking at them, Gorgon is a mass-murdering genius who uses his intellect to not only form his cult of terrorists, but he has taken over The Hand and Hydra in the past.

Whether he is a side mission boss or one of the main threats, Gorgon will be a brutal fight for players. His stone-freezing ability could be a stressful game mechanic where Wolverine has to look away from his eyesight, or it's game over. As a bonus, Gorgon's cultists could be another faction of enemies to fight in the game.

6 Sentinels

X-Men Staples For Iconic Battles

  • First Appearance : Wolverine Vol. 3 #20
  • Real Name : Tomi Shishido
  • Last Video Game Appearances : Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3, Marvel Contest Of Champions, Marvel Snap

It's almost impossible not to feature the deadly Sentinels in any X-Men game. Even other games starring Wolverine in the past featured Sentinels, but fans might love a modern take on the mutant-hunting robots due to advances in technology to portray them even better than before.

Even if Marvel's Wolverine only features one Sentinel, Insomniac could borrow from games such as God Of War by having cinematic fights against a giant foe while still keeping the player engaged with strong gameplay. Also, the Sentinels could be a way for fans to get surprise appearances from famous X-Men characters such as Beast, Cyclops, or even Storm.

5 Wendigo

Wolverine's First Villain Deserves Respect

  • First Appearance : The Incredible Hulk #162
  • Real Name : Paul Cartier, Georges Baptiste, Francois Lartigue, and various others.
  • Last Video Game Appearances : Marvel Super Hero Squad Online, LEGO Marvel Avengers, Marvel's Guardians Of The Galaxy

Like with Hulk, Wendigo is important to Logan's history, thus earning the character a place in Marvel's Wolverine . Wendigo was the creature that killed people in Canadian forests, incidentally framing the Hulk and becoming Wolverine's first villain in the comics.

The Wendigo has seen various incarnations; from a curse transforming humans into monsters to an extraterrestrial being like in Marvel's Guardians Of The Galaxy . Since Insomniac made many changes to the many Spider-Man villains, there is a chance they will do the same with Marvel's Wolverine and give characters like Wendigo new or familiar origins.

4 Lady Deathstrike

She Is Technically The Prototype Wolverine

  • First Appearance : Daredevil #197
  • Real Name : Paul Cartier, Georges Baptiste, Francois Lartigue, and various others.
  • Last Video Game Appearances : Marvel Ultimate Alliance 2, Marvel Heroes: Omega, Marvel Strike Force

Lady Deathstrike is a cyborg with many similarities to him, such as her Adamantium claws and a healing factor created by her father before Weapon X ever accomplished it. Deathstrike's obsession with destroying Logan could easily make her a recurring threat in Marvel's Wolverine , with Logan having to deal with being punished for the sins of Weapon X.

Lady Deathstrike's claws combined with her fighting capability make her in many ways deadlier than Wolverine due to her hatred for him. She's faster than Logan, and similar abilities render her almost impossible to kill; an ideal combination for one or more boss fights in Marvel's Wolverine .

3 Omega Red

A Super Soldier Even Avengers Fear

  • First Appearance : X-Men Vol. 2 #4
  • Real Name : Arkady Rossovich
  • Last Video Game Appearances : X-Men Legends 2: Rise Of Apocalypse, X2: Wolverine's Revenge (GameBoy Advance version only), Marvel Puzzle Quest

In a way, Omega Red was created because of Logan as a result of Russian forces learning of the Weapon X program and Marvel's Wolverine could explore this by having Arkady Rossovich as a major threat. So much so, that Omega Red has battled all the powerful members of the X-Men and even Spider-Man.

Rossovich was already a dangerous murderer with a tactical mind, but when given powerful strength, tentacles grafted onto his body, and healing that rivals Logan's, he became one of Marvel's most deadly villains. A character like Omega Red could result in Marvel's Wolverine surprising fans with another playable mutant or even Yuri Lowenthal returning as Spider-Man.

2 Weapon X Program

Vital To The Origins Of Wolverine

  • First Appearance : Marvel Comics Presents #72
  • Real Name : Weapon Plus Program
  • Last Video Game Appearances : X-Men Legends, X-Men Legends 2: Rise Of Apocalypse, X-Men Origins: Wolverine

Given how Logan's entire history with the Adamantium coating his bones comes from Weapon X, their inclusion in Marvel's Wolverine is warranted. Whether it is as the main focus or via flashback sequences, Wolverine's dark past with the evils of Weapon X could make for the best character growth for Logan.

The team of mutants and mercenaries that Logan served with in Weapon X would be a series of boss fights themselves. It also could allow the game to fix the common misconception that William Stryker created Wolverine's Adamantium state when there were two evil scientists: Abraham Cornelius and Truett Hudson.

1 Sabretooth

The Ultimate Archnemesis For Logan

  • First Appearance : Iron Fist #14
  • Real Name : Victor Creed
  • Last Video Game Appearances : Marvel Puzzle Quest, Marvel Strike Force, Marvel's Midnight Suns

At this point, it is almost guaranteed that Sabretooth will either be in Marvel's Wolverine or alluded to tease a sequel. Sabretooth is as much a rival to Wolverine as Green Goblin is to Spider-Man; he's always there to torment Logan physically and emotionally, having a very long and complicated history.

Both of them served in the Weapon X program and at one point, they were good friends, but due to multiple memory lapses, their history is all sorts of convoluted. What is known is that Sabretooth takes great pleasure in seeing Logan suffer, which is the perfect dynamic for a villain in Marvel's Wolverine .

item.title: The First Descendant: Best Mods For Thunder Cage
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Toxic Enhancement Module boosts the Thunder Cage's damage output with Toxic ATK by up to 30%.
  • The Better Concentration Mod increases the Thunder Cage's Critical Hit Damage by up to 37.2%.
  • The Rifling Reinforcement Module adds Explosive ATK damage, scaling to 32% for max level.

By now, The First Descendant has been played by thousands of people worldwide, receiving critical acclaim from some and hard criticism from others. Whatever the case, it's undeniable that the game is really fun to play, has a complete and wide catalog of different classes, weapons, and Modules, and poses entertaining challenges.

One of the best ways to increase players' chance of survival when dealing with dozens of aggressive enemies at the same time are weapon Modules (or Mods). These allow players to add different types of damage to their weapons, which, in turn, results in quicker ways to deal with enemies with considerably less effort. The Thunder Cage SMG is one of the best weapons in The First Descendant , and with the right modifications, it can be an unstoppable force. Here are the best mods for Thunder Cage .

5 Toxic Enhancement

A Boost In Toxic ATK Damage

How To Get

Old Mystery Mission Monster (Hard), Ransacked Village Mission Monster (Normal), and more

Effect

Adds Toxic ATK equal to 8% of Firearm ATK

Toxic Damage is one of the strongest in The First Descendant . Not only does it have a long-lasting effect, but it can be combined with different weapons, playstyles, and character Mods, making it lethal and effective against small or large groups of enemies. Characters like Freyna are great examples of the raw power this damage type offers when used properly.

With the Toxic Enhancement Module , players can maximize their Thunder Cage SMG's damage output greatly by adding Toxic ATK damage to every bullet they fire. This Mod's base level offers up to 8% Toxic ATK Damage increase relative to the firearm's Firearm ATK; however, it can be upgraded all the way to Level 10, which boosts the additional Toxic damage from 8% to 30%. And considering that the Thunder Cage SMG is a high fire rate weapon, Toxic buildup can happen very quickly as long as players hit their desired targets often.

4 Better Concentration

A Decent Increase In Firearm Critical Hit Damage

How To Get

Caligo Ossuary Mission Monster (Normal), Kuiper Depot Mission Monster (Normal), and more

Effect

Increases Firearm Critical Hit Damage by 19%

Regardless of the game being discussed, Critical Hit Damage is arguably one of the strongest Damage types out there. Not only can it greatly reduce the Health bar of bosses and area enemies in the blink of an eye, but there's also a certain satisfaction when it finally activates. In the case of The First Descendant , Critical Hit Damage is no different, and it works as players would expect. By adding the Better Concentration Mod to the Thunder Cage SMG, players can maximize Critical Hit Damage output greatly while also shortening the buildup time for it.

Similar to the Toxic Enhancement Mod, Better Concentration scales up as players increase it in level. The base Critical Damage Hit percentage for this Mod is 9%; however, if increased to the maximum level (10), this stat grows to 37.2%, turning any player with the Thunder Cage into a powerhouse that can deal ridiculous amounts of damage in short periods.

3 Rifling Reinforcement

Great To Deal Additional Explosive ATK Damage

How To Get

Vulgus Data Trasmitter Mission Monster (Normal), The Haven Mission Monster (Normal), and more

Effect

Increases Explosive ATK by 12%

Any player who loves FPS games has a soft spot for massive explosions that not only look cool but can take out large groups of enemies with a loud, glorious, and fiery bang. The First Descendant excels at explosions and overall at firearm combat, even from the early stages of the game. The Rifling Enforcement Mod is a great example of this. When added to the Thunder Cage SMG, it increases Explosive ATK by 12% at the base level. If increased to the maximum level, this number grows considerably, reaching a whopping 32%.

This Mod can be a great addition to characters based on speed, agility, and quick firing abilities, as the combination of swift dodging, rapid firing, and explosive damage is deadly. Bunny , for example, would be a great choice to pair this weapon and Mod with, so any players looking for fast-paced action and heart-racing combat should definitely try the combination out.

2 Concentration Priority

Faster Reloading & Higher Critical Hit Damage

How To Get

Tethered Energy Position Complete (Hard), Cargo Management Zone Mission Monster (Normal)

Effect

Increases Firearm Critical Hit Damage by 30%, Reduces Reload Time Modifier by 8%

So far, this list has only covered Mods with single effects; however, there are several others with more than one stat increase that should be explored, and the Concentration Priority Mod is one of them. This excellent Module for the Thunder Cage SMG not only raises Critical Hit Damage by 30%, but it also reduces the Reload Time Modifier by 8%.

The modification of said stats means that players can deal more damage while reloading considerably faster, which provides a great advantage when using non-tanky characters like Bunny, who focuses more on speed, dodging, and fast lightning attacks to deal with the numerous enemies threatening her. The Concentration Priority Mod should be on every player's arsenal as they complete the various main missions in The First Descendant .

1 Chill Enhancement

Ideal For Adding Chill ATK Damage

How To Get

Baggage Transport Base Complete (Normal), Outpost Workshop Mission Monster (Normal)

Effect

Adds Chill ATK equal to 8% of Firearm ATK

Last but not least, there's the Chill Enhancement Module , which adds Chill ATK equal to 8% of the Thunder Cage SMG's Firearm ATK. This number, however, is only true for the base level of the Mod; if players level up and raise the Mod to level 10, the added Chill ATK damage grows to a staggering 30%, which is absolutely ridiculous and can help gamers deal with enemies much faster while struggling considerably less. This is especially true if they unlock the right characters first.

There are many ways to get this Mod, including completing the Asylum Monster mission in Hard Difficulty, the Ossuary Monster Mission in Normal Difficulty, and the Kuiper Depot Monster Mission in Normal Difficulty. Depending on how players progress through the game, they might get this Mod soon or after they've put in a few hours. Whatever the case, it's undeniable that the Chill Enhancement Mod is a must-have.

item.title: Future Assassin's Creed Games Could Be Making a Positive Change
item.description:
Highlights

  • Assassin's Creed Shadows producer Karl Onnée said four-year development cycles offer "the right balance" for iteration, which he finds crucial to making good games.
  • His comments suggest future Assassin's Creed games could also have longer development cycles.
  • This would fit wider industry trends, as AAA game development cycles have generally been getting longer in recent years.

Future Assassin's Creed games could have longer development cycles compared to the current series standard, a senior Ubisoft official has suggested. Many Assassin's Creed fans would likely characterize this as a positive change, as a vocal portion of the fandom has long been calling for longer development cycles for the franchise.

The Assassin's Creed series had annual releases from 2009 to 2015. Since then, Ubisoft has put out four more mainline games and is about to launch its fifth one in November 2024, thus averaging one new title every two years. The company's individual development cycles have progressively gotten longer over this period, with that trend culminating in Assassin's Creed Shadows , which is already the series' longest-running project that's been in the works for approximately four years.

Assassin's Creed Shadows Producer Says 4-Year Dev Cycles Offer 'the Right Balance'

Reflecting on this state of affairs in a recent interview with GamesIndustry.biz, Assassin's Creed Shadows lead producer Karl Onnée suggested that four years might be the new norm for the series, at least as far as his own projects are concerned. "Four years, I think, is the right balance to go from conception to production and get the feedback necessary to adapt," the industry veteran explained. Onnée also identified incessant iteration as the key to continuing to meet the series' quality standards. That's something that he feels cannot be hurried even at a company the size of Ubisoft, which is one of the largest independent game developers on the planet.

Past a Certain Point, Making Good Games Requires Time More Than People

Elaborating on that point, the official explained that throwing more people at a project might help it get completed more quickly, but still isn't conducive to iteration. For that, there's only one resource that matters, time. "The more time you have, the more you can iterate," Onnée said. It is through this prism that the producer framed four-year development cycles as offering "the right balance" for developers.

Time is also what will tell whether other Ubisoft studios in charge of the Assassin's Creed franchise share Onnée's perspective. But seeing how AAA game development cycles have been getting longer across the board in recent times, the notion of all future Assassin's Creed games adopting four-year cycles is consistent with industry trends.

The next mainline installment after Ubisoft Quebec's AC Shadows is expected to be Assassin's Creed Codename Hexe , which is presently in the works at Ubisoft Montreal. When exactly Hexe started development is unclear, but the project's existence was officially confirmed in September 2022 alongside Shadows , which was known as Assassin's Creed Codename Red at the time.
